newsitem.title: ESTONIA: LIVIKO SAYS WILL SEEK LISTING ON BOURSE.
newsitem.headline: LIVIKO SAYS WILL SEEK LISTING ON BOURSE.

text.p: Estonia's largest alchoholic drinks producer Liviko said on Friday that it would definitely seek a stock market listing after the privatisation of a further 20 percent stake this year.
"We will definitely seek a listing after a minority stake has been privatised," chairman Udo Themas told Reuters.
Some 5 percent of the company was sold last year and 95 percent is still state-owned.
The shares are currently traded on the over-the-counter market at 148 kroons and the five percent sahres were sold for vouchers at 115 kroons.
"I believe that the state will continue the privatisation and sell at least 20 percent of our shares this year," Eino Tamm, board chairman, told the shareholder meeting.

Liviko's best-known brands are Viru Valga vodka and the Vana Tallinn liqueur. Liviko has 49 percent of the sales of the Estonian vodka market, some 23 percent has been captured by other producers while a huge 28 percent is illegal vodka production.
